story.text: BOGOTA Jan 2 Colombia's net international reserves fell 1.53 percent to $15.43 billion in the week to Dec. 27, versus the week before, but the amount far exceeded the central bank's goal of holding $12.7 billion at the end of 2006. The bank, which has not announced the amount of reserves it plans to have at the end of 2007, issued a statement on Tuesday that did not give a reason for week's the drop. ($1 = 2,238.79 Colombian pesos)
story.title: colombian foreign reserves fall 1 . 53 pct in week
